entry.title: [Elasticsearch] elasticsearch dsl íŒŒì´ì¬ ì˜ˆì œ - ì—°ê²°, ìƒ‰ì¸
entry.summary: elasticsearch-dsl ì‚¬ìš© ì˜ˆì œ, ê¸°ì¡´ ì½”ë“œì™€ ë¹„êµ
entry.content:
elasticsearch dsl ì‚¬ìš© ì˜ˆì œ - 1í¸ - ì—°ê²°ê³¼ ìƒ‰ì¸

elasticsearch dslì„ í†µí•´ì„œ elasticsearchë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•´ë³´ë ¤í•œë‹¤.

ê¸°ì¡´ ì‚¬ìš©ë°©ë²•ë“¤ë„ í•¨ê»˜ ì²¨ë¶€í•˜ë©´ì„œ ì–´ë–¤ì ì´ ë‹¬ë¼ì§€ëŠ”ì§€ í™•ì¸í•´ë³´ì!

1. ì—°ê²° (connect)

{@html String.raw`
# ê¸°ì¡´ ì—°ê²°
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch
# ì½”ë””ë„¤ì´í„° ë…¸ë“œì™€ ì—°ê²°
ES_HOSTS = ["http://localhost:9200"]
ES_CLIENT = Elasticsearch(ES_HOSTS)
ES_CLIENT = Elasticsearch(ES_HOSTS, timeout=30) # connection timeout ì„¤ì •
`}
{@html String.raw`
# elasticsearch dsl ì—°ê²°
from elasticsearch_dsl import connections
# port ë¥¼ ëª…ì‹œí•´ì•¼í•¨.
ES_HOSTS = ["http://localhost:9200"]
ES_HOSTS_DEV = ["http://localhost:9200"]
ES_HOSTS_STAGE = ["http://localhost:9200"]
ES_HOSTS_PROD = ["http://localhost:9200"]
  
# ì—°ê²° . Searchì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©.(2,3 í™•ì¸)  
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS, alias="local")
# timeout ì„¤ì •  
  
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS, timeout=60 * 60 * 1, alias="local")
# alias ë¥¼ ëª…ì‹œí•  ì‹œ dev/stage/prodë¥¼ êµ¬ë¶„í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ.  
  
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS_DEV, timeout=60 * 60 * 1, alias="dev")
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS_STAGE, timeout=60 * 60 * 1, alias="dev")
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS_PROD, timeout=60 * 60 * 1, alias="prod")
# sniff_on_start ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ë©´ lazy connectê°€ ê°€ëŠ¥  
  
connections.create_connection(hosts=ES_HOSTS, timeout=60 * 60 * 1, alias="local", sniff_on_start=False)
`}

2. ìƒ‰ì¸ (index)

{@html String.raw`
#ê¸°ì¡´  
# index, mapping ìƒì„±  
# ê¸°ì¡´. helpers ì‚¬ìš©  
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch, helpers
# ... es ìƒì„± ìƒëµ  
bulk_action_list = []
products = [] # doc info [(doc_id, info)]
for doc_id, info in products:
    # action ìƒì„±    
    action = {
        "_op_type": "index",
        "_index": "my_index",
        "_id": doc_id,
        "_source": info, # op_typeì´ updateì¼ ê²½ìš° "doc"ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€ê²½     
        }
    bulk_action_list.append(action)
# ìƒ‰ì¸
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
    raise_on_error=False,
    chunk_size=config.chunk_size
)
# ìƒ‰ì¸ì‹œ chunk ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ ìƒ‰ì¸  
CHUNK_SIZE = 100
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
)
# ìƒ‰ì¸ì‹œ chunk ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ ìƒ‰ì¸, response ê²°ê³¼ ê°„ì†Œí™”.  
# helpers lib ë‹¨ì—ì„œ ê²°ê³¼ë¥¼ ê°„ì†Œí™”í•¨. esì‘ë‹µì„ ì™„ì „ ê°„ì†Œí™”í•˜ëŠ” ë°©ë²•ì€ esìƒ‰ì¸ ìµœì í™” í¬ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•˜ê¸° ë°”ëŒ(ì¶”í›„ ì—…ë¡œë“œ ì˜ˆì •)  
CHUNK_SIZE = 100
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
    stats_only=True,
)
# ìƒ‰ì¸ì‹œ chunk ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ ìƒ‰ì¸ , error ë¬´ì‹œ  
CHUNK_SIZE = 100  
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
    chunk_size=CHUNK_SIZE
)
# ìƒ‰ì¸ì‹œ chunk ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ ìƒ‰ì¸ , error ë¬´ì‹œ , ìƒ‰ì¸ê³¼ ë™ì‹œì— index refresh  
CHUNK_SIZE = 100
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
    raise_on_error=False,
    chunk_size=CHUNK_SIZE,
    refresh=True,
)
# ìƒ‰ì¸ì‹œ chunk ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ë¶„í• í•˜ì—¬ ìƒ‰ì¸ , error ë¬´ì‹œ , ìƒ‰ì¸ê³¼ ë™ì‹œì— index refresh , ì¬ì‹œë„ íšŸìˆ˜ ì§€ì •  
CHUNK_SIZE = 100  
MAX_RETRIES = 3  
_res = helpers.bulk(
    ES_CLIENT,
    bulk_action_list,
    raise_on_error=False,
    chunk_size=CHUNK_SIZE,
    refresh=True,
    max_retries=MAX_RETRIES,
)
`}
{@html String.raw`
# elasticsearch_dsl
# index , mapping ì„¤ì •
from elasticsearch_dsl import Index
settings = {} # setting ì„¤ì •  
# es document model ìƒì„±  
# https://elasticsearch-dsl.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#elasticsearch_dsl.Index.document   
from elasticsearch_dsl import (
    Boolean,
    Date,
    DenseVector,
    Document,
    HalfFloat,
    Index,
    Integer,
    Keyword,
    Long,
    Nested,
    Text,
)
# ì–´ë…¸í…Œì´ì…˜ìœ¼ë¡œ indexì˜ mapping ì„ ì–¸  
@my_index.document  
class EsDocument(Document):
    keyword_field = Keyword()
    text_field = Text()
    integer_field = Integer()
    boolean_field = Boolean()
    
    
# classëŠ” ë‚´ë¶€ì— ì„ ì–¸í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ.  
class EsDocument(Document):
    title = Text()
    author = Keyword()
    content = Text()
    published_at = Date()
    class Index:
        name = 'my_index'        
        settings = {
            "number_of_shards": 1,
            "number_of_replicas": 0        
            }  
            
index_name = "my_index"  
es_url = "http://localhost:9200"  
#request ì´ìš©.  
def generate_index(es_url: str, index_name: str) -> None:
    # load mappings     
    _index = Index(index_name)  
    _index.settings(**settings)
    _index.document(EsDocument)
    mappings = _index.to_dict()
    try:
        res = requests.put(es_url, json=mappings)
        if res.status_code != 200:
            raise Exception(res.json())
        logger.info("Index is created")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(e)
        raise e
    finally:
        logger.info("FINISH")
        
        
generate_index(es_url, index_name)  
# dsl ì´ìš©.  
my_index = Index('my_index')  
my_index.settings(**settings)
my_index.create()
my_index.save()
  
# ìƒ‰ì¸  
  
# # bulkì˜ ê²½ìš° helpersë¥¼ ê·¸ëŒ€ë¡œ ì´ìš©.   
from elasticsearch import Elasticsearch, helpers  
products = [EsDocument()] # EsDocumentë¥¼ ê°€ì§€ê³  info ìƒì„±  
bulk_action_list = [
    {
        "_op_type": "index",
        "_index": doc.Index.name,
        "_id": doc.meta.id,
        "_source": doc.to_dict(include_meta=False)
    }
    for doc in products
]
# ... ì´í›„ ë™ì¼
`}

entry.title: Hello QWER ğŸ‘‹
entry.summary: ğŸ‰ Let's start a brand new awesome blog...
entry.content:
ğŸ‘‹ Hello World

Hello WÃªreld! PÃ«rshendetje BotÃ«! áˆ°áˆ‹áˆ áˆá‹‘áˆ! Ù…Ø±Ø­Ø¨Ø§ Ø¨Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø§Ù„Ù…! Ô²Õ¡Ö€Õ¥Ö‚ Õ¡Õ·Õ­Õ¡Ö€Õ°! Kaixo Mundua! ĞŸÑ€Ñ‹Ğ²Ñ–Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¡ÑƒÑĞ²ĞµÑ‚! à¦“à¦¹à§‡ à¦¬à¦¿à¦¶à§à¦¬! Ndewo á»¤wa! Halo Dunia! Ciao mondo! ã“ã‚“ã«ã¡ã¯ä¸–ç•Œï¼ Ğ¡Ó™Ğ»ĞµĞ¼ Ó˜Ğ»ĞµĞ¼! áŸá½áŸáŸ’áá¸â€‹á–á·á—á–á›áŸ„á€! Ğ¡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ´Ò¯Ğ¹Ğ½Ó©! àºªàº°â€‹àºšàº²àºâ€‹àº”àºµâ€‹àºŠàº²àº§â€‹à»‚àº¥àº! Sveika pasaule! entry.title: About QWER
entry.content:
ğŸ‰ QWER

QWER is a blog starter and static site generator, built with Svelte and SvelteKit.

âœ¨ Features

  • âš¡ Super fast site performance. Near Perfect PageSpeed score.

  • ğŸ¤— SEO ready with meta, Open Graph, Schema, JSON-LD, microformats2.

  • ğŸ” On-site Search.

  • ğŸ“± Mobile-First / Responsive design.

  • âœï¸ Write post with Markdown syntax.

  • ğŸ§® ğŸ§ª Wirte Math and Chemical formulas with TeX Syntax via Katex & mhchem.

  • ğŸ“ Folder-based organization for creating posts.

  • ğŸ·ï¸ Multi-Tags filtering.

  • ğŸ“„ Auto-Generate Table of Content for posts.

  • ğŸ“¦ Out-of-the-box support for Atom feed, Sitemap, PWA, JSON Feed.

  • ğŸ–¼ï¸ Automatic image optimization via vite-imagetools.

  • âš™ï¸ Support embedding Svelte components and Javascript with Markdown.

  • ğŸ’¬ Supports Giscus - a comments system powerd by Github Discussions.

  • ğŸ’„ Utilizes UnoCSS - the instant on-demand atomic CSS engine.

  • ğŸŒ i18n via typesafe-i18n.

  • ğŸš€ Deploy the blog Free on Vercel or Netlify.

ğŸ“š Learn More

Please read more at our Documentation.

ğŸ‘· Current State

QWER is at its' very early stage. Kindly expect frequent breaking changes.

Just copy and paste your user folder to the latest release.

Watch out for the CHANGELOG to see if yor are required to migrate user/config or other places.

â“ Issues / Problems / Questions

Please take advantage of our Github's Q&A Discussion board.

ğŸ˜Š Are you using QWER?

Please consider adding svelte-qwer topic to your repository.

To see who else are using QWER, please check Github-Topics: svelte-qwer.

ğŸ‰ Support

ğŸ¥“ Buy me a Bacon

ğŸ“ License

MIT

ğŸ™ Credits

  • Cover Photo by Jess Bailey on Unsplash

  • Avatar Illustration by Liam Moore from Ouch!

ğŸ‘ END

Thanks so much for interesting in QWER. Please try it out and let me know what you think ğŸ˜Š.

This n22n^{22}n22 and that cosâ¡(2Î¸)=cosâ¡2Î¸âˆ’sinâ¡2Î¸\cos (2\theta) = \cos^2 \theta - \sin^2 \thetacos(2Î¸)=cos2Î¸âˆ’sin2Î¸

Chemical Typesetting

{@html String.raw`ZnX2+â‡Œ+2â€‰HX++2â€‰OHXâˆ’Zn(OH)X2â†“amphoteresÂ Hydroxidâ‡Œ+2â€‰HX++2â€‰OHXâˆ’[Zn(OH)X4]X2âˆ’Hydroxozikat\ce{Zn^2+ <=>[+ 2OH-][+ 2H+] $\underset{\text{amphoteres Hydroxid}}{\ce{Zn(OH)2 v}}$ <=>[+ 2OH-][+ 2H+] $\underset{\text{Hydroxozikat}}{\ce{[Zn(OH)4]^2-}}$}ZnX2++2OHXâˆ’+2HX+â€‹amphoteresÂ HydroxidZn(OH)X2â€‹â†“â€‹+2OHXâˆ’+2HX+â€‹Hydroxozikat[Zn(OH)X4â€‹]X2âˆ’â€‹`}

1 
class Greeter {
2

3

4

5

6

9+

console.log("Test");
`}

![github-mark-svg](/shared/github-mark.svg)
`}

Youtube

Custom Svelte Component

{@html String.raw`
<script lang="ts">
  const const_variable = 999;
</script>
Variable is {const_variable}
`}

Variable is {const_variable}

{@html String.raw`
{(function () {
const guess = Math.random()
if (guess > 0.66) {
return `<span style="color: tomato">Look at us.</span>`
}
if (guess > 0.33) {
return `<span style="color: violet">Who would have guessed?!</span>`
}
return `<span style="color: goldenrod">Not me.</span>`
})()}
`}

{@html (function () { const guess = Math.random() if (guess > 0.66) { return `Look at us.` } if (guess > 0.33) { return `Who would have guessed?!` } return `Not me.` })()}

    Indent paragraphs to include them in the footnote.
    { my code }
    Add as many paragraphs as you like.

    â†©

entry.title: Quick Start
entry.content:
âœ¨ Intro

QWER is simply an Awesome blog starter and static site generator. Built using SvelteKit and Love â¤.

ğŸ‰ Try out QWER

Create a QWER blog named my-blog.

{@html String.raw`
npx degit kwchang0831/svelte-QWER my-blog
`}

âš¡ï¸ To Dev

  1. Install all the dependencies.

    {@html String.raw`
    pnpm i
    `}

  2. Start local dev server.

    {@html String.raw`
    pnpm dev
    `}

  3. Sever is running. Open browser to see the result.

    {@html String.raw`
    VITE v3.1.1  ready in 1080 ms
    âœ  Local:   http://localhost:5173/
    âœ  Network: use --host to expose
    `}

ğŸš€ To Deploy

  1. Create a free Vercel account.

  2. Install Vercel CLI

    {@html String.raw`
    npm i -g vercel
    `}

  3. Using the vercel command from the root of a project directory.

    {@html String.raw`
    vercel
    `}

    You will be asked to login for the first time. Simply follow the prompts.

  4. Deploy as Production build

    {@html String.raw`
    vercel deploy --prod
    `}

ğŸ“š Learn More

Here is our Documentation: https://docs-svelte-qwer.vercel.app/.

ğŸ‘ END
